result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon M. Hidrogo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Johnathon M. Hidrogo in court with attorney David Zarwell.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. TAD program director Wendy McGurk is present; This is sentencing on revocation of TAD DPA; State heard on whether Def. complied with TAD program, State notes Def. has not and will be recomm. prison, PSI ordered; Atty. Zarwell contests whether Def. should have been removed from TAD program; State calls Wendy McGurk, sworn and testifies; witness excused; Atty. Zarwell heard; Court finds Def. never completed the program, absconded and was revoked from program; Court will revoke the TAD DPA and will set for sentencing; PSI discussed; Court orders PSI; Sent set; bond cont.

This hearing is on case 12CF399, not 15CF228.  Defendant Johnathon M. Hidrogo in court. Julie Wilhelm appeared for Dodge County.  Court questions Mr. Hidrogo.  Atty.
